definition: classical story or quote from the literature/the story behind sth
canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead
historical or literary anecdote that gives rise to a saying

sentences.english: The abundance of linguistic culture leads to diversifications in the contents and forms of allusions.
sentences.chinese: 丰富的语言文化造就了典故语丰富多彩的内容和形式。

sentences.english: Now, the VOA Special English program, Words and Their Stories.
sentences.chinese: 这里是美国之声慢速英语的词语典故报道。

sentences.english: The second part of the point source of the term for sending good luck and allusions.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分点出师造化一词的来源及其典故。

sentences.english: What allusions, if any, are in the text?
sentences.chinese: 如果文本用典，那是什么样的典故？

sentences.english: This is the story of hardships known Gou same.
sentences.chinese: 这与家喻户晓的勾践卧薪尝胆的典故如出一辙。

sentences.english: In the poem, there are many Biblical allusions.
sentences.chinese: 在这首诗中，有许多关于圣经的典故。

sentences.english: The poem contains several allusions to the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 这首诗引用了《圣经》上的几个典故。

sentences.english: Then there have been a lot of legends and stories about cranes. Red-crowned Crane can live as long as 60 years.
sentences.chinese: 有不少关于鹤的传说和典故。

sentences.english: The explanation provided discomposure , stories, allusions, syntax and so on.
sentences.chinese: 提供神色仓皇的解释，故事，典故，造句等内容。

sentences.english: The literary quotation is a kind of important lyric carrier.
sentences.chinese: 典故是山谷词抒情的一个重要载体。

sentences.english: We will talk about that on another Words and Their Stories.
sentences.chinese: 我们将会在下期词汇典故节目中讨论它。

sentences.english: On Chinese dice, the numbers one and four are painted red. What is the story behind it?
sentences.chinese: 骰子的一点与四点被漆上白色的典故是什么？

sentences.english: We should not use proverbs and allusions indiscriminately.
Is it the true allusion of tea-egg in China?
sentences.chinese: 这真的是中国的茶叶蛋的典故吗？

sentences.english: One of the allusions was not exactly coarse, but somewhat vulgar.
sentences.chinese: 其中有个典故，谈不上很粗鲁，但却有点庸俗。

sentences.english: Andy:And what about The Bull down the road?
sentences.chinese: 那路尽头那家“公牛”又有什么典故呢？

definition: Chinese set expression, typically of 4 characters, often alluding to a story or historical quotation/idiom/proverb/saying/adage/CL:條|条[tiao2],本[ben3],句[ju4]
historical or literary anecdote that gives rise to a saying
famous saying/celebrated phrase
mythological story/myth
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
popular tradition/folk legend
anecdote/apocryphal story
legend/folklore/to repeat from mouth to mouth/they say that...
folk story/folktale
variant of 逸事[yi4 shi4]
lit. the snow piles up at Cheng Yi's door (idiom)/fig. deep reverence for one's master
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
verse/CL:行[hang2]
old classics/old customs/cause
famous piece of writing
anecdote/lost or apocryphal story about famous person
